tool.name: SAGA.grid_analysis.6
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayA True isArrayB True output_data_DIST $output_data_DIST output_data_DIR $output_data_DIR output_data_C $output_data_C name SAGA.grid_analysis.6 A $A B $B ANGLE $ANGLE C_OUT $C_OUT prefer $prefer response $response outputType_DIST $OutputSection_DIST.outputType_DIST transmissionMode_DIST $OutputSection_DIST.transmissionMode_DIST outputType_DIR $OutputSection_DIR.outputType_DIR transmissionMode_DIR $OutputSection_DIR.transmissionMode_DIR outputType_C $OutputSection_C.outputType_C transmissionMode_C $OutputSection_C.transmissionMode_C

param.name: A
param.label: Initial State
param.help: Initial State The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi

param.name: B
param.label: Final State
param.help: Final State The following data types are allowed in the txt file: png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi

param.name: ANGLE
param.label: Angle Calculation
param.help: angle calculation is only available when exact two features are compared

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_DIST
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_DIST
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_DIR
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_DIR
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

section.name: OutputSection_C
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_C
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool performs a change vector analysis (CVA) for the given input features. Input features are supplied as grid lists for initial and final state. In both lists features have to be given in the same order. Distance is measured as Euclidean distance in features space. When analyzing two features direction is calculated as angle (radians) by default. Otherwise direction is coded as the quadrant it points to in terms of feature space.
